Built-in Library¶

States¶

Classes:

VectorState

A standard vector-based state, with value represented by a 1D numpy array.

MatrixLieGroupState

The MatrixLieGroupState class.

SO2State

SO3State

SE2State

SE3State

SE23State

CompositeState

A “composite” state object intended to hold a list of State objects as a single conceptual “state”.
class pynav.lib.states.VectorState(value: numpy.ndarray, stamp: Optional[float] = None, state_id=None)¶

Bases: pynav.types.State

A standard vector-based state, with value represented by a 1D numpy array.

plus(dx: numpy.ndarray)¶

A generic “addition” operation given a dx numpy array with as many elements as the dof of this state.

minus(x: pynav.lib.states.VectorState) → numpy.ndarray¶

A generic “subtraction” operation given another State object of the same type, always returning a numpy array.

copy() → pynav.lib.states.VectorState¶

Returns a copy of this State instance.

value¶

State value

Type

Any

dof¶

Degree of freedom of the state

Type

int

stamp¶

Timestamp

Type

float

state_id¶

Some identifier associated with the state

Type

Any

jacobian(x: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Jacobian of the plus operator. For Lie groups, this is known as the group Jacobian.

class pynav.lib.states.CompositeState(state_list: List[pynav.types.State], stamp: Optional[float] = None, state_id=None)¶

Bases: pynav.types.State

A “composite” state object intended to hold a list of State objects as a single conceptual “state”. The intended use is to hold a list of poses as a single state at a specific time.

Parameters

state_list (List[State]) – List of State that forms this composite state

Each state in the provided list has an index (the index in the list), as well as a state_id, which is found as an attribute in the corresponding State object.

It is possible to access sub-states in the composite states both by index and by ID.

value¶

The substates are the CompositeState ‘s value.

Type

List[State]

stamp¶

Timestamp

Type

float

state_id¶

Some identifier associated with the state

Type

Any

property dof¶
get_index_by_id(state_id)¶

Get index of a particular state_id in the list of states.

get_slice_by_id(state_id)¶

Get slice of a particular state_id in the list of states.

get_value_by_id(state_id)¶

Get state value by id.

get_state_by_id(state_id)¶

Get state object by id.

get_dof_by_id(state_id)¶

Get degrees of freedom of sub-state by id.

substates¶
get_stamp_by_id(state_id)¶

Get timestamp of sub-state by id.

jacobian(x: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Jacobian of the plus operator. For Lie groups, this is known as the group Jacobian.

set_stamp_by_id(stamp: float, state_id)¶

Set the timestamp of a sub-state by id.

set_stamp_for_all(stamp: float)¶

Set the timestamp of all substates.

to_list()¶

Converts the CompositeState object back into a list of states.

copy() → pynav.lib.states.CompositeState¶

Returns a new composite state object where the state values have also been copied.

plus(dx, new_stamp: Optional[float] = None)¶

Updates the value of each sub-state given a dx. Interally parses the dx vector.

minus(x: pynav.lib.states.CompositeState) → numpy.ndarray¶

A generic “subtraction” operation given another State object of the same type, always returning a numpy array.

plus_by_id(dx, state_id: int, new_stamp: Optional[float] = None)¶

Updates a specific sub-state.

jacobian_from_blocks(block_dict: dict)¶

Returns the jacobian of the entire composite state given jacobians associated with some of the substates. These are provided as a dictionary with the the keys being the substate IDs.

Models¶

Classes:

SingleIntegrator

The single-integrator process model is a process model of the form

BodyFrameVelocity

The body-frame velocity process model assumes that the input contains both translational and angular velocity measurements, both relative to a local reference frame, but resolved in the robot body frame.

RelativeBodyFrameVelocity

CompositeProcessModel

Should this be called a StackedProcessModel?

CompositeMeasurementModel

Wrapper for a standard measurement model that assigns the model to a specific substate (referenced by state_id) inside a CompositeState.

RangePointToAnchor

Range measurement from a point state to an anchor (which is also another point).

RangePoseToAnchor

Range measurement from a pose state to an anchor.

RangePoseToPose

Range model given two absolute poses of rigid bodies, each containing a tag.

RangeRelativePose

Range model given a pose of another body relative to current pose.

GlobalPosition

Global, world-frame, or “absolute” position measurement.

Altitude

Gravitometer

Gravitometer model of the form

Magnetometer

Magnetometer model of the form

InvariantMeasurement

Given a Measurement object, the class will construct a left- or right-invariant innovation ready to be fused into a state estimator.
class pynav.lib.models.SingleIntegrator(Q: numpy.ndarray)¶

Bases: pynav.types.ProcessModel

The single-integrator process model is a process model of the form

x_dot = u .

evaluate(x: pynav.lib.states.VectorState, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarray¶
jacobian(x, u, dt) → numpy.ndarray¶
covariance(x, u, dt) → numpy.ndarray¶
jacobian_fd(x: pynav.types.State, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarray¶

Calculates the model jacobian with finite difference.

class pynav.lib.models.BodyFrameVelocity(Q: numpy.ndarray)¶

Bases: pynav.types.ProcessModel

The body-frame velocity process model assumes that the input contains both translational and angular velocity measurements, both relative to a local reference frame, but resolved in the robot body frame.

This is commonly the process model associated with SE(n).

evaluate(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState¶
jacobian(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarray¶
covariance(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarray¶
jacobian_fd(x: pynav.types.State, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: float) → numpy.ndarray¶

Calculates the model jacobian with finite difference.

class pynav.lib.models.CompositeMeasurementModel(model: pynav.types.MeasurementModel, state_id)¶

Bases: pynav.types.MeasurementModel

Wrapper for a standard measurement model that assigns the model to a specific substate (referenced by state_id) inside a CompositeState.

evaluate(x: pynav.lib.states.CompositeState) → numpy.ndarray¶

Evaluates the measurement model \(\mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})\).

jacobian(x: pynav.lib.states.CompositeState) → numpy.ndarray¶

Evaluates the measurement model Jacobian \(\mathbf{G} = \partial \mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})/ \partial \mathbf{x}\).

covariance(x: pynav.lib.states.CompositeState) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns the covariance \(\mathbf{R}\) associated with additive Gaussian noise.

jacobian_fd(x: pynav.types.State)¶

Calculates the model jacobian with finite difference.

class pynav.lib.models.Gravitometer(R: numpy.ndarray, gravity_vector: List[float] = [0, 0, - 9.80665])¶

Bases: pynav.types.MeasurementModel

Gravitometer model of the form

\[\mathbf{y} = \mathbf{C}_{ab}^T \mathbf{g}_a + \mathbf{v}\]

where \(\mathbf{g}_a\) is the magnetic field vector in a world frame a.

Parameters

  • R (np.ndarray) – Covariance associated with \(\mathbf{v}\)

  • gravity_vector (list[float] or numpy.ndarray, optional) – local magnetic field vector, by default [0, 0, -9.80665]

evaluate(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState)¶

Evaluates the measurement model \(\mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})\).

jacobian(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState)¶

Evaluates the measurement model Jacobian \(\mathbf{G} = \partial \mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})/ \partial \mathbf{x}\).

covariance(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns the covariance \(\mathbf{R}\) associated with additive Gaussian noise.

jacobian_fd(x: pynav.types.State)¶

Calculates the model jacobian with finite difference.

class pynav.lib.models.Magnetometer(R: numpy.ndarray, magnetic_vector: List[float] = [1, 0, 0])¶

Bases: pynav.types.MeasurementModel

Magnetometer model of the form

\[\mathbf{y} = \mathbf{C}_{ab}^T \mathbf{m}_a + \mathbf{v}\]

where \(\mathbf{m}_a\) is the magnetic field vector in a world frame a.

Parameters

  • R (np.ndarray) – Covariance associated with \(\mathbf{v}\)

  • magnetic_vector (list[float] or numpy.ndarray, optional) – local magnetic field vector, by default [1, 0, 0]

evaluate(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState)¶

Evaluates the measurement model \(\mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})\).

jacobian(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState)¶

Evaluates the measurement model Jacobian \(\mathbf{G} = \partial \mathbf{g}(\mathbf{x})/ \partial \mathbf{x}\).

covariance(x: pynav.lib.states.MatrixLieGroupState) → numpy.ndarray¶

Returns the covariance \(\mathbf{R}\) associated with additive Gaussian noise.

jacobian_fd(x: pynav.types.State)¶

Calculates the model jacobian with finite difference.

class pynav.lib.models.InvariantMeasurement(meas: pynav.types.Measurement, direction='right')¶

Bases: pynav.types.Measurement

Given a Measurement object, the class will construct a left- or right-invariant innovation ready to be fused into a state estimator.

If a right-invariant innovation is chosen then the following will be formed.

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}\mathbf{z} &= \bar{\mathbf{X}}(\mathbf{y} - \bar{\mathbf{y}})\\&= \bar{\mathbf{X}}(\mathbf{g}(\mathbf{X}) + \mathbf{v} - \mathbf{g}(\bar{\mathbf{X}}))\\&\approx \bar{\mathbf{X}}( \mathbf{g}(\bar{\mathbf{X}}) + \mathbf{G}\delta \mathbf{\xi} + \mathbf{v} - \mathbf{g}(\bar{\mathbf{X}}))\\&= \bar{\mathbf{X}}\mathbf{G}\delta \mathbf{\xi} + \bar{\mathbf{X}}\mathbf{v}\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

and hence \(\bar{\mathbf{X}}\mathbf{G}\) is the Jacobian of \(\mathbf{z}\), where \(\mathbf{G}\) is the Jacobian of \(\mathbf{g}(\mathbf{X})\). Similarly, if a left-invariant innovation is chosen,

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}\mathbf{z} &= \bar{\mathbf{X}}^{-1}(\mathbf{y} - \bar{\mathbf{y}})\\&\approx \bar{\mathbf{X}}^{-1}\mathbf{G}\delta \mathbf{\xi} + \bar{\mathbf{X}}^{-1}\mathbf{v}\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

and hence \(\bar{\mathbf{X}}^{-1}\mathbf{G}\) is the Jacobian of \(\mathbf{z}\).

Parameters

  • meas (Measurement) – Measurement value

  • direction ("left" or "right", optional) – whether to form a left- or right-invariant innovation, by default “right”

value¶

Container for the measurement value

Type

numpy.ndarray

stamp¶

Timestamp

Type

float

model¶

measurement model associated with this measurement.

Type

pynav.types.MeasurementModel
